first_reading.title: Letter to the Romans
first_reading.text:
[[Rm 7,18]]Brothers and sisters: I know that good does not dwell in me, that is, in my flesh. The willing is ready at hand, but doing the good is not.
[[Rm 7,19]]For I do not do the good I want, but I do the evil I do not want.
[[Rm 7,20]]Now if (I) do what I do not want, it is no longer I who do it, but sin that dwells in me.
[[Rm 7,21]]So, then, I discover the principle that when I want to do right, evil is at hand.
[[Rm 7,22]]For I take delight in the law of God, in my inner self,
[[Rm 7,23]]but I see in my members another principle at war with the law of my mind, taking me captive to the law of sin that dwells in my members.
[[Rm 7,24]]Miserable one that I am! Who will deliver me from this mortal body?
[[Rm 7,25a]]Thanks be to God through Jesus Christ our Lord.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 12,54]]Jesus said to the crowds, “When you see a cloud rising in the west you say immediately that it is going to rain–and so it does;
[[Lc 12,55]]and when you notice that the wind is blowing from the south you say that it is going to be hot--and so it is.
[[Lc 12,56]]You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky; why do you not know how to interpret the present time?
[[Lc 12,57]]Why do you not judge for yourselves what is right?
[[Lc 12,58]]If you are to go with your opponent before a magistrate, make an effort to settle the matter on the way; otherwise your opponent will turn you over to the judge, and the judge hand you over to the constable, and the constable throw you into prison.
[[Lc 12,59]]I say to you, you will not be released until you have paid the last penny."

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 119,66]]Teach me wisdom and knowledge, 
for in your commands I trust.

[[Ps 119,68]]You are good and bountiful; 
teach me your statutes.

[[Ps 119,76]]Let your kindness comfort me 
in accord with your promise to your servant.

[[Ps 119,77]]Let your compassion come to me that I may live, 
for your law is my delight.

[[Ps 119,93]]I will never forget your precepts; 
through them you give me life.

[[Ps 119,94]]I am yours; save me, 
for I have sought your precepts.
